ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Excellent material, with clear useful applications to medicine and public health. Evidence-based health care is becoming more important today and this class does a good job of teaching the core concepts.
Strengths: stresses critical thinking skillsbroad applications to many medical/public health specialties
This is a great course to learn to do a systematic review of the literature.

This course has a lot of relevance to my research interests so I found it very interesting. The lectures were thoughtfully presented and provided a lot of useful information. The Thursday sessions were engaging... maybe could try out different formats of discussing articles (maybe have students present or work in groups to analyze a study).

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Michael Bracken  Dr. Bracken was an excellent professor - the lectures were informative, and the group discussions were helpful for clarifying the concepts.
Instructor: Michael Bracken  Nothing to change.The embodiment of intelligence put to good use.If every instructor were like Dr Bracken, there'd be no need for student evaluations.
Instructor: Michael Bracken  Dr. Bracken is very receptive to student comments and is available for feedback whenever it is needed.
Instructor: Michael Bracken  Dr. Bracken was very knowledgeable and could add a lot of personal insight into the discussions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A course with potential applications to your future real-world practice - evidence-based practice is quite important and this class does a good job of teaching the core concepts. Learn how to do a meta-analysis!

Evidence-based medicine is a cornerstone of medical science.Dr Bracken is a leader in this field and in many facets of clinical, genetic, and neonatal research today.Dr Bracken also happens to be about as good a thinker and communicator as you can find -- in any school or field.He's also very wry and trenchant -- so do the required readings! You'll never be sorry you did the required readings.This course should be required for every faculty member and student in YSPH, in Yale Med School, and in the Yale School of Nursing, but then of course that would ruin it.
Excellent course for advanced epidemiologists or clinicians with a public health interest
This is a course where you learn how to do a comprehensive literature search and write a systematic review. I would recommend it to any student who wants to learn searching and review techniques.
I think this course is very useful - I think I have a more discerning eye towards the literature and feel a lot more comfortable conducting reviews.
